Heading: States where killing occurred
Value: Towns of: Hyde, Tameside, Great Manchester, West Yorkshire, etc.

Heading: Number of siblings
Value: Two siblings; he was born the 2nd of three

Heading: Raised by
Value: His mother-had many restrictions on him about being social

Heading: Birth category
Value: He was born in the middle of two other siblings

Heading: Family event
Value: His Mother, Vera, dies – He had taken care of her a great deal

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: Other children and people thought of him as a “loner”; he was not a social person

Heading: Physically attractive?
Value: Not really unattractive, just has the look of an older doctor

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: His mother was overprotective and didn’t allow him to socialize

Heading: Mother’s occupation
Value: Stayed at home with the children

Heading: Highest grade in school
Value: He finished school and attended college and medical school

Heading: Grades in school
Value: Describes his grades as adequate enough to receive his degree

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Fired from jobs?
Value: Yes, forced out of practice at Pontefract General Infirmary

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value:
Junior Doctor at Pontefract General Hospital, Yorkshire, GB; General Practitioner at Todmorden Group Practice in 
Todmorden, GB; Clinical Medical Officer in South West Durham, GB; General Practitioner at Donneybrook House Group Practice in Hyde, Cheshire, GB; Ran his own General Practitioner practice (The Surgery) in Hyde, Cheshire, GB.

Heading: Marital status
Value: Married at age 19 to a girl who was 17 and 5 months pregnant

Heading: Living with
Value: Wife and while they were young, his children

Heading: Time in forensic hospital?
Value: Spent time at The Retreat, a psychiatric center in York.

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value: Prescribing Pethidine for patients and taking it himself

Heading: Victim type
Value: Elderly people, mostly women- his patients

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Method of killing
Value: Giving his patients, who were otherwise healthy, an overdose of morphine; he was able to face the families of his victims without even the slightest bit of guilt.

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: All victims were patients at his practice, and all but one were killed in their homes if he had made a house call

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Value: Yes, he would visit patients in their home and sometimes say when he got there they were close to death.

Heading: Killing occurred in home of killer?
Behavior During Crimes- His attitude towards victims and families was rude, arrogant and uncompassionate
Quick & efficient?
Value: Yes,  in fact patients submitted willingly, with no idea they were in danger

Heading: Took totem – personal item
Value: Uncertain, speculation that he took jewelry from some of his patients.

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Sentencing
Value: Convicted of killing 15 patients with lethal injections of Diamorphine

Heading: Killer executed?
Value: No, put in prison for life

Heading: Name and state of prison
Value: HMP Wakefield Prison, West Yorkshire, England

Heading: Killer committed suicide?
Value: Yes, hung himself in prison from the cell bars with his bed sheets. They said he definitely should have been on suicide watch at the prison
